title: 103_hr2143
content:
The Act titled "Nuclear Regulatory Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995" authorizes appropriations for those fiscal years. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, with specific amounts allocated for each year. Additionally, funds are authorized for the Office of Inspector General within the Commission. In accordance with section 1105(a)(25) of title 31, United States Code, the following amounts are authorized:
- Fiscal year 1994: $4,800,000, available until expended.
- Fiscal year 1995: $5,000,000, available until expended. SEC. 3. ALLOCATION OF AMOUNTS AUTHORIZED. The amounts authorized for fiscal years 1994 and 1995 are allocated as follows: $163,807,000 for "Reactor Safety and Safeguards Regulation", $99,969,000 for "Reactor Safety Research", $61,880,000 for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation", and funds for "High-level nuclear waste regulation". For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund are allocated for various purposes: $22,000,000 for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation", $31,000,000 for "Reactor Special and Independent Reviews, Investigations, and Enforcement", and $164,244,000 for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support". For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funds allocated for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support" are limited to $164,244,000 for 1994 and $164,062,000 for 1995. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can use up to 1% of these funds for grants and cooperative agreements with organizations. Reallocation of funds allocated for specific programs is allowed, subject to certain conditions. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds from one program to another within subsection (a) or for any other activity. The amount available for a program cannot be increased or reduced by more than $500,000 without advance notification to specific committees. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds within programs with advance notification to specific committees. Funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund are designated for high-level nuclear waste activities and cannot be used for other Commission activities. SEC. 4. RETENTION OF CERTAIN FUNDS.

Money received by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for cooperative nuclear safety research, services to foreign governments, and material access programs can be retained for salaries and expenses, subject to appropriations, and remain available until expended.

SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS.

The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can transfer funds to its Office of Inspector General, not exceeding 5 percent of the authorized amount for the fiscal year.

SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON SPENDING AUTHORITY.

No payments can be made under this Act without prior approval in appropriation Acts.
